channel.title: Math homework help
channel.description:
Hey guys, I'm in Algebra 2 right now and my teacher just assigned a worksheet worth 40 points and I'm stumped on every problem. It probably would help if I had a graphing calculator, but, I don't. Thanks in advance if you help.
Problems:
***Full credit will only be given if justification is shown and the answer is rounded correctly. If you use technology, show a diagram of what you used.***
1. The function y = -16t² + 336 models the height [I]y[/I] in feet of a stone [I]t[/I] seconds after it is dropped from the edge of a vertical cliff. How long will it take the stone to hit the ground? Round to the nearest hundredth of a second.
What I did so far was: [code]y = -16t² + 336 0 = -16t² + 336 -336 = -16t² 21 = t² t = 4.582[/code] Tell me if I did anything wrong.
2. Draw parallelogram ABCD. BC is 16 inches longer than AB. Find the height of the parallelogram to the nearest thousandth if the area is 2231 and m∠ABC = 60°. Avoid rounding in the middle of the problem.
3. During a manufacturing process, a metal part in a machine is exposed to varying temperature conditions. The temperature [I]T[/I] in degrees Fahrenheit [I]x[/I] minutes after the machine is put into operation is modeled by T = -0.005x² + 0.45x + 125. After how many minutes will the temperature reach 200 degrees?
4. The tale shows a meteorologists's predicted temperatures for an April day in Washington D.C. starting at 8:00 AM. Time - Predicted Temperature (°F) 8 AM - 44.11 10 AM - 53.85 12 PM - 59.46 2 PM - 60.93 4 PM - 58.26 6 PM - 51.46
a) Using the temperature at 2 PM as the high temperature and the temperature at 8:00 AM, write a quadratic function in vertex form to estimate the temperature at a given time. Round to the nearest thousandth.
b) Predict the temperature at 11:00 AM using your function from a).
c) Use quadratic regression to find a quadratic function that predicts the temperature at a given time. Round to the nearest thousandth.
d) To the nearest tenth of a degree and to the nearest minute, use the function form from c) to determine the high temperature and at what time it occured.
e) Predict at what time the temperature was 46 degrees.
---------------------------------------- Again, thank you in advance.

item.title: Math homework help
item.dc:creator: @noobn noobn
item.description:
@noobn wrote:

Hey guys, I’m in Algebra 2 right now and my teacher just assigned a worksheet worth 40 points and I’m stumped on every problem. It probably would help if I had a graphing calculator, but, I don’t.
Thanks in advance if you help.

Problems:

Full credit will only be given if justification is shown and the answer is rounded correctly. If you use technology, show a diagram of what you used.

  1. The function y = -16t² + 336 models the height y in feet of a stone t seconds after it is dropped from the edge of a vertical cliff. How long will it take the stone to hit the ground? Round to the nearest hundredth of a second.

What I did so far was:

y = -16t² + 336 0 = -16t² + 336 -336 = -16t² 21 = t² t = 4.582
Tell me if I did anything wrong.

  1. Draw parallelogram ABCD. BC is 16 inches longer than AB. Find the height of the parallelogram to the nearest thousandth if the area is 2231 and m∠ABC = 60°. Avoid rounding in the middle of the problem.

  2. During a manufacturing process, a metal part in a machine is exposed to varying temperature conditions. The temperature T in degrees Fahrenheit x minutes after the machine is put into operation is modeled by T = -0.005x² + 0.45x + 125. After how many minutes will the temperature reach 200 degrees?

  3. The tale shows a meteorologists’s predicted temperatures for an April day in Washington D.C. starting at 8:00 AM.
    Time - Predicted Temperature (°F)
    8 AM - 44.11
    10 AM - 53.85
    12 PM - 59.46
    2 PM - 60.93
    4 PM - 58.26
    6 PM - 51.46

a) Using the temperature at 2 PM as the high temperature and the temperature at 8:00 AM, write a quadratic function in vertex form to estimate the temperature at a given time. Round to the nearest thousandth.

b) Predict the temperature at 11:00 AM using your function from a).

c) Use quadratic regression to find a quadratic function that predicts the temperature at a given time. Round to the nearest thousandth.

d) To the nearest tenth of a degree and to the nearest minute, use the function form from c) to determine the high temperature and at what time it occured.

e) Predict at what time the temperature was 46 degrees.

Again, thank you in advance.

Read full topic
